issue.title: Remove the visibility conditions upsell
issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the requested feature in a clear and concise way. -->

The general idea is that the PRO upsells should not confuse users and don't let them experience the feature properly. In this case the button is too obvious, more obvious than Add a rule setting: https://vertis.d.pr/i/F6fl2m. For a first time user of the feature, our priority is that they try the feature & only after we ask for an upgrade.

Possible solutions: 

1. Simple one, remove that button: https://vertis.d.pr/i/F6fl2m. The user would open the dropdown and they would see that there are more options and which one as well, there is no better upsell than this.2. 

2. More complicated. Show a cleaner upgrade button, but only after the user added at least a rule on their site.

### Alternatives:
<!-- If we don't implement this feature, what would be the best alternatives to achieve the same functionality? -->

cc @HardeepAsrani @mghenciu

issue.title: Posts block doesn't show the Sticky post as a featured post.
issue.body:
### Description:
A user has asked about this on the wp.org forum that if he can use the sticky post as a featured post in Otter's posts block.

When you use the Posts block and turn on the featured post option, then the sticky post doesn't appear as a featured post. The sticky post appears at the top of the Blog/Archive page so his query is if it can be also used here and if it could appear as a featured post.

P.s  - I am not sure If I should add an enhancement tag or the bug tag.😅

### How to reproduce:

1. Create some demo posts.
2. Go to any random post and make it a sticky post by going to post settings [See attached screenshot in reference].
3. Install Otter and Create a new page.
4. Use Otter's **Posts Block** and turn on the featured post option. 
5. Go to the page and observe that the post which is featured on top is the latest post that was created by you. If you will create a new post then the new post will appear as a Featured post.
6. Now go to the Blog/Archive page and see that the sticky post appears at the top instead of the latest post.


### Expected behavior:
The posts block should show the Sticky post as a featured post. 

### Current behavior:
The posts block doesn't show the Sticky post as a featured post. 

### Reference:
<!-- Screenshots and links that show the bug -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110405452/201397469-6dfecb4c-d578-43a5-9254-8c90911dec9e.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110405452/201399366-11be7018-7aa7-4586-9a2f-fcc4fae2f1d9.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110405452/201398979-f066c956-3473-4fe9-8daf-f456668e390d.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110405452/201399183-31b22879-b5df-4372-abee-df3987ecf789.png)

The user asked here : https://wordpress.org/support/topic/can-i-keep-the-sticky-post-as-the-featured-post-in-the-posts-block/
### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1
* Plugin version: 2.1.3

issue.title: Query loops with Otter Dynamic Values and Links

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: Custom layouts
labels.description: Issues related to the compatibility between Otter and Neve custom layouts

issue.body:
We will need to discuss and see how we will manage the **Custom Layout Archive templates** using Otter. Currently I have attempted to use Otter Dynamic values and links inside the Core query loops.

An example can be found in this page: https://demosites.io/otter/category/technology/

As you see, in the context of query loop the Dynamic (featured) image and the Post excerpt do not appear to work. This will be important in the context of the hybrid approach we will attempt for Neve as well.

![Screenshot 2022-10-17 at 19 47 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4193672/196236194-8403ffb0-7453-442a-87ab-4919dde28f31.png)

Is it possible to make our Otter dynamic elements work well in the Core's query loop? Or it is worth looking into how we can develop our custom Query loop solution?

issue.title: Product Review Block Structured Data Issue with 1-5 Rating Scale

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
When using the 1-5 rating scale, there are some cases that generate structured data to be invalid.
When you enable a 1-5 rating scale in Otter options the scale in the editor still shows a 1-10 scale. Depending on the ratings you input this can lead to invalid structured data.

### How to reproduce:
1. Enable the 1-5 rating scale in Otter options
2. Add a review block with 4 product features 
3. Give each feature a rating of 1 star.

### Expected behaviour:
The final rating for this product should be 1 start.

### Current behaviour:
The final rating for this product is 0.5 stars.
Even though the schema is valid when I run it through the [validator](https://validator.schema.org/), this still throws and error in [Rich Results Test](https://search.google.com/test/rich-results) and shows up in GSC. The error in question is: 'Rating is outside the specified or default range.'

### Reference:
[Example](https://finmasters.com/restoration-hardware-credit-card-review/)

### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1.1
* Plugin version: 2.1.4

issue.title: Sticky Banner Mode
issue.body:
<!-- Issues that this pull request closes. -->
Closes #.
<!-- Should look like this: `Closes #1, #2, #3.` . -->

### Summary
<!-- Please describe the changes you made. -->

Make the sticky block act like a banner by adding extra space at the top of the page.

New options:

- `o-sticky-header-space`: activate the header space
- `o-sticky-header-gap-{value}`: set gap space. By default, it uses the block `height`, but is not always reliable. Use this to make adjustments. Example: `o-sticky-banner-gap-50px`, adds a margin of 50px to the body.


### Screenshots <!-- if applicable -->

issue.title: Evergreen Reset Fix
issue.body:
<!-- Issues that this pull request closes. -->
Closes #1377 .
<!-- Should look like this: `Closes #1, #2, #3.` . -->

### Summary
<!-- Please describe the changes you made. -->

Add a fix for Evergreen reset and docs.

### Screenshots <!-- if applicable -->

----

### Test instructions
<!-- Describe how this pull request can be tested. -->

1. Add a Countdown with the mode Evergreen
2. Set the time, then preview.
3. Test time reset on __refresh__, which has the conditions:
    1. Time is over.
    2. Timezone has changed 
    3. Deadline has changed.

If you think the time should have reset in a situation that is not mentioned, please post the scenario 🙏 .

For Timezone, you can use the Sensor tab from the browser Dev Tools (Chrome)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17597852/206193298-079091af-3119-4b66-804a-d08aa94440a8.png)

issue.body: ### Description: As seen in the Image, Source tags don't have a bottom margin, which causes them to be stacked Adding a margin-bottom: 16px on .fz-form-wrap .tagify__tag, should fix the issue. ### How to reproduce: 1. Install a fresh Feedzy instance with the default Core theme - Twenty Twenty-Three 2. Go to the Import Posts page, and start an import 3. Paste more sources, so those go on at least 2 lines ### Expected behaviour: ### Current behaviour: ### Reference: ### Technical info * WordPress version: 6.1 * Plugin version: 4.0.5

issue.title: Unable to add all the Magic tags in one flow.
issue.body:
### Description:
Hey there, I noticed this minor bug in the import job process of the feedzy. When you will create an import job and try to add the magic tags to the **Content field**, then you will notice that you are not able to add all the tags in one flow from the dropdown.

In order to add another tag you will have to click out somewhere on the screen, and only then you will be able to add other tags.

I tried to do the same thing with the **Title field** and it is working fine, we can add multiple tags in one flow.

Thank you.

### How to reproduce:

1. Create an Import job.
2. See the screencast video replicating this issue.


### Reference:
See this screencast: https://vertis.d.pr/v/FcpMdH

### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1
* Plugin version: 4.0.5

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 21.3.0 to 22.1.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

22.1.0 (2022-11-16)

Enhancements

  • ColorPalette, BorderBox, BorderBoxControl: polish and DRY prop types, add default values (#45463).
  • TabPanel: Add ability to set icon only tab buttons (#45005).

Internal

  • AnglePickerControl: remove :focus-visible' outline on CircleOutlineWrapper` (#45758)

Bug Fix

  • FormTokenField: Fix duplicate input in IME composition (#45607).
  • Autocomplete: Check key events more strictly in IME composition (#45626).
  • Autocomplete: Fix unexpected block insertion during IME composition (#45510).
  • Icon: Making size prop work for icon components using dash icon strings (#45593)
  • ToolsPanelItem: Prevent unintended calls to onDeselect when parent panel is remounted and item is rendered via SlotFill (#45673)
  • ColorPicker: Prevent all number fields from becoming "0" when one of them is an empty string (#45649).
  • ToggleControl: Fix toggle control label text overflow (#45962).

Internal

  • ToolsPanel: Update to fix exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45715).
  • PaletteEditListView: Update to ignore exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45467).
  • Popover: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45656).
  • Flex: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45528).
  • withNotices: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45530).
  • ItemGroup: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45531).
  • TabPanel: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45660).
  • NavigatorScreen: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45648).
  • Draggable: Convert to TypeScript (#45471).
  • MenuGroup: Convert to TypeScript (#45617).
  • useCx: fix story to satisfy the react-hooks/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45614)
  • Activate the react-hooks/exhuastive-deps eslint rule for the Components package (#41166)
  • Snackbar: Convert to TypeScript (#45472).

Experimental

  • ToggleGroupControl: Only show enclosing border when isBlock and not isDeselectable (#45492).
  • Theme: Add support for custom background color (#45466).

22.0.0 (2022-11-02)

Breaking Changes

  • Popover: The deprecated range and __unstableShift props have been removed (#45195).

Deprecations

  • Popover: the deprecation messages for anchor-related props (anchorRef, anchorRect, getAnchorRect) have been updated (#45195).

labels.name: dependencies

labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 21.3.0 to 22.1.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

22.1.0 (2022-11-16)

Enhancements

  • ColorPalette, BorderBox, BorderBoxControl: polish and DRY prop types, add default values (#45463).
  • TabPanel: Add ability to set icon only tab buttons (#45005).

Internal

  • AnglePickerControl: remove :focus-visible' outline on CircleOutlineWrapper` (#45758)

Bug Fix

  • FormTokenField: Fix duplicate input in IME composition (#45607).
  • Autocomplete: Check key events more strictly in IME composition (#45626).
  • Autocomplete: Fix unexpected block insertion during IME composition (#45510).
  • Icon: Making size prop work for icon components using dash icon strings (#45593)
  • ToolsPanelItem: Prevent unintended calls to onDeselect when parent panel is remounted and item is rendered via SlotFill (#45673)
  • ColorPicker: Prevent all number fields from becoming "0" when one of them is an empty string (#45649).
  • ToggleControl: Fix toggle control label text overflow (#45962).

Internal

  • ToolsPanel: Update to fix exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45715).
  • PaletteEditListView: Update to ignore exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45467).
  • Popover: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45656).
  • Flex: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45528).
  • withNotices: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45530).
  • ItemGroup: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45531).
  • TabPanel: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45660).
  • NavigatorScreen: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45648).
  • Draggable: Convert to TypeScript (#45471).
  • MenuGroup: Convert to TypeScript (#45617).
  • useCx: fix story to satisfy the react-hooks/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45614)
  • Activate the react-hooks/exhuastive-deps eslint rule for the Components package (#41166)
  • Snackbar: Convert to TypeScript (#45472).

Experimental

  • ToggleGroupControl: Only show enclosing border when isBlock and not isDeselectable (#45492).
  • Theme: Add support for custom background color (#45466).

22.0.0 (2022-11-02)

Breaking Changes

  • Popover: The deprecated range and __unstableShift props have been removed (#45195).

Deprecations

  • Popover: the deprecation messages for anchor-related props (anchorRef, anchorRect, getAnchorRect) have been updated (#45195).

issue.title: customizer is not loading if Neve v3.4.6 is used with PHP v8.0.x

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the bug in a clear and concise way. -->
The theme customizer is not loading if Neve v3.4.6 is used with PHP v8.0.x. I have checked with 8.0.11, 8.0.25, and 8.0.26. If we rollback the theme to its previous version, it works fine with all PHP versions. 

The same issue occurs if we use the latest version of OrbitFox. If a site has Neve and Orbit Fox, then we need to roll back both of them to get the customizer work again. 

### How to reproduce:
<!-- Describe the steps needed to reproduce this. -->
1. Create an instance with PHP v8.0.11, 8.0.25, or 8.0.26.
2. Install Neve
3. Access customizer

### Expected behaviour:
customizer should load properly.

### Current behaviour:
customizer is not loading, 

### Reference:
<!-- Screenshots and links that show the bug -->
Screenshot >>https://vertis.d.pr/i/b1fDRt
### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1.1
* Theme version: 3.4.6
* HS Tickets: https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/2078727475/346297?folderId=212390
* https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/2080399962/346513?folderId=212390

issue.title: [wip] Dynamic Value Additions
issue.body:
<!-- Issues that this pull request closes. -->
Closes #1218.
<!-- Should look like this: `Closes #1, #2, #3.` . -->

### Summary
<!-- Please describe the changes you made. -->
- Added Parameter based Dynamic Value
- Added a country location for Dynamic Value & Conditions using https://www.geoplugin.com
- Add Cookie based Block Conditions

### Screenshots <!-- if applicable -->

----

### Test instructions
<!-- Describe how this pull request can be tested. -->

1. A parameter-based dynamic value, so you can show a value, let's say brand, based on if the user has that keyword as a parameter in their URL, like example.com?brand=puma, then it will display Puma.

2. A location-based Dynamic Condition to show your country and Block conditions. It's based on your IP so might not be correct 100% of the times, maybe test with VPN too to see.

3. It's similar to how Meta works but just with PHP cookies. You can see how you can add cookie to your website, you can use the otter-blocks.php file to add the code and view the website in the frontend: https://www.w3schools.com/php/php_cookies.asp

---- 

### Checklist before the final review

- [x] Visual elements are not affected by independent changes.
- [x] It is at least compatible with the [minimum WordPress version](https://wordpress.org/plugins/otter-blocks/).
- [x] It loads additional script in frontend only if it is required.
- [x] Does not impact the [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/vitals/).
- [x] In case of deprecation, old blocks are safely migrated.
- [x] It is usable in Widgets and FSE.
- [x] Copy/Paste is working if the attributes are modified.

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
A user on wp.org told that he is getting an Accessibility issue with the Neve Menu navigation on accessibility/section 508 scanners. The lack of space generates the following accessibility error. The error Says - `“No space between attributes.”` 

We need to update the inc/views/nav_walker.php file (line 136) and insert a space after the role=”none” parameter.

Thanks

### Expected behaviour:
https://vertis.d.pr/i/Y3EIMp

### Current behaviour:
https://vertis.d.pr/i/9CKbFL
### Reference:
https://wordpress.org/support/topic/accessibility-missing-space-on-menu-html/

* Theme version: 3.4.3

issue.title: Remove the visibility conditions upsell
issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the requested feature in a clear and concise way. -->

The general idea is that the PRO upsells should not confuse users and don't let them experience the feature properly. In this case the button is too obvious, more obvious than Add a rule setting: https://vertis.d.pr/i/F6fl2m. For a first time user of the feature, our priority is that they try the feature & only after we ask for an upgrade.

Possible solutions: 

1. Simple one, remove that button: https://vertis.d.pr/i/F6fl2m. The user would open the dropdown and they would see that there are more options and which one as well, there is no better upsell than this.2. 

2. More complicated. Show a cleaner upgrade button, but only after the user added at least a rule on their site.

### Alternatives:
<!-- If we don't implement this feature, what would be the best alternatives to achieve the same functionality? -->

cc @HardeepAsrani @mghenciu

issue.title: Posts block doesn't show the Sticky post as a featured post.
issue.body:
### Description:
A user has asked about this on the wp.org forum that if he can use the sticky post as a featured post in Otter's posts block.

When you use the Posts block and turn on the featured post option, then the sticky post doesn't appear as a featured post. The sticky post appears at the top of the Blog/Archive page so his query is if it can be also used here and if it could appear as a featured post.

P.s  - I am not sure If I should add an enhancement tag or the bug tag.😅

### How to reproduce:

1. Create some demo posts.
2. Go to any random post and make it a sticky post by going to post settings [See attached screenshot in reference].
3. Install Otter and Create a new page.
4. Use Otter's **Posts Block** and turn on the featured post option. 
5. Go to the page and observe that the post which is featured on top is the latest post that was created by you. If you will create a new post then the new post will appear as a Featured post.
6. Now go to the Blog/Archive page and see that the sticky post appears at the top instead of the latest post.


### Expected behavior:
The posts block should show the Sticky post as a featured post. 

### Current behavior:
The posts block doesn't show the Sticky post as a featured post. 

### Reference:
<!-- Screenshots and links that show the bug -->

issue.title: Query loops with Otter Dynamic Values and Links

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: Custom layouts
labels.description: Issues related to the compatibility between Otter and Neve custom layouts

issue.body:
We will need to discuss and see how we will manage the **Custom Layout Archive templates** using Otter. Currently I have attempted to use Otter Dynamic values and links inside the Core query loops.

An example can be found in this page: https://demosites.io/otter/category/technology/

As you see, in the context of query loop the Dynamic (featured) image and the Post excerpt do not appear to work. This will be important in the context of the hybrid approach we will attempt for Neve as well.

![Screenshot 2022-10-17 at 19 47 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4193672/196236194-8403ffb0-7453-442a-87ab-4919dde28f31.png)

Is it possible to make our Otter dynamic elements work well in the Core's query loop? Or it is worth looking into how we can develop our custom Query loop solution?

issue.title: Product Review Block Structured Data Issue with 1-5 Rating Scale

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
When using the 1-5 rating scale, there are some cases that generate structured data to be invalid.
When you enable a 1-5 rating scale in Otter options the scale in the editor still shows a 1-10 scale. Depending on the ratings you input this can lead to invalid structured data.

### How to reproduce:
1. Enable the 1-5 rating scale in Otter options
2. Add a review block with 4 product features 
3. Give each feature a rating of 1 star.

### Expected behaviour:
The final rating for this product should be 1 start.

### Current behaviour:
The final rating for this product is 0.5 stars.
Even though the schema is valid when I run it through the [validator](https://validator.schema.org/), this still throws and error in [Rich Results Test](https://search.google.com/test/rich-results) and shows up in GSC. The error in question is: 'Rating is outside the specified or default range.'

### Reference:
[Example](https://finmasters.com/restoration-hardware-credit-card-review/)

### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1.1
* Plugin version: 2.1.4

issue.title: Sticky Banner Mode
issue.body:
<!-- Issues that this pull request closes. -->
Closes #.
<!-- Should look like this: `Closes #1, #2, #3.` . -->

### Summary
<!-- Please describe the changes you made. -->

Make the sticky block act like a banner by adding extra space at the top of the page.

New options:

- `o-sticky-header-space`: activate the header space
- `o-sticky-header-gap-{value}`: set gap space. By default, it uses the block `height`, but is not always reliable. Use this to make adjustments. Example: `o-sticky-banner-gap-50px`, adds a margin of 50px to the body.

issue.title: Unable to add all the Magic tags in one flow.
issue.body:
### Description:
Hey there, I noticed this minor bug in the import job process of the feedzy. When you will create an import job and try to add the magic tags to the **Content field**, then you will notice that you are not able to add all the tags in one flow from the dropdown.

In order to add another tag you will have to click out somewhere on the screen, and only then you will be able to add other tags.

I tried to do the same thing with the **Title field** and it is working fine, we can add multiple tags in one flow.

Thank you.

### How to reproduce:

1. Create an Import job.
2. See the screencast video replicating this issue.


### Reference:
See this screencast: https://vertis.d.pr/v/FcpMdH

### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1
* Plugin version: 4.0.5

- Allow adding all the Magic tags in one flow #697 
- Improve image import support in PRO
- Improve full content import in various languages

issue.title: Make sure Review Ratings are minimum 1 for Schema
issue.body:
<!-- Issues that this pull request closes. -->
Closes #1375.
<!-- Should look like this: `Closes #1, #2, #3.` . -->

### Summary
<!-- Please describe the changes you made. -->

This makes sure whatever the rating is, the minimum value stays at 1.
----

### Test instructions
<!-- Describe how this pull request can be tested. -->
- Please make sure the rating numbers, both in front/back, are same and consistent regardless of the weight scale used, 1-10 or 1-5, which can be toggled from Otter settings

---- 

### Checklist before the final review

- [x] Visual elements are not affected by independent changes.
- [x] It is at least compatible with the [minimum WordPress version](https://wordpress.org/plugins/otter-blocks/).
- [x] It loads additional script in frontend only if it is required.
- [x] Does not impact the [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/vitals/).
- [x] In case of deprecation, old blocks are safely migrated.
- [x] It is usable in Widgets and FSE.
- [x] Copy/Paste is working if the attributes are modified.

Release notes

Sourced from @​typescript-eslint/parser's releases.

v5.45.0

5.45.0 (2022-11-28)

Bug Fixes

  • eslint-plugin: [array-type] --fix flag removes parentheses from type (#5997) (42b33af)
  • eslint-plugin: [keyword-spacing] prevent crash on no options (#6073) (1f19998)
  • eslint-plugin: [member-ordering] support private fields (#5859) (f02761a)

Features

  • eslint-plugin: [member-ordering] add a required option for required vs. optional member ordering (#5965) (2abadc6)

v5.44.0

Bug Fixes

  • eslint-plugin: [no-empty-interface] disable autofix for declaration merging with class (#5920) (a4f85b8)

  • eslint-plugin: [prefer-optional-chain] handle binary expressions in negated or (#5992) (2778ff0)
  • typescript-estree: don't consider a cached program unless it's specified in the current parserOptions.project config (#5999) (530e0e6)

Features

  • eslint-plugin: [adjacent-overload-signatures] check BlockStatement nodes (#5998) (97d3e56)
  • eslint-plugin: [keyword-spacing] Support spacing in import-type syntax (#5977) (6a735e1)
  • support parsing satisfies operators (#5717) (20d7cae)
  • update to TypeScript 4.9 (#5716) (4d744ea)

v5.43.0

Bug Fixes

issue.title: chore(deps-dev): bump @wordpress/components from 21.3.0 to 22.1.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 21.3.0 to 22.1.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

22.1.0 (2022-11-16)

Enhancements

  • ColorPalette, BorderBox, BorderBoxControl: polish and DRY prop types, add default values (#45463).
  • TabPanel: Add ability to set icon only tab buttons (#45005).

Internal

  • AnglePickerControl: remove :focus-visible' outline on CircleOutlineWrapper` (#45758)

Bug Fix

  • FormTokenField: Fix duplicate input in IME composition (#45607).
  • Autocomplete: Check key events more strictly in IME composition (#45626).
  • Autocomplete: Fix unexpected block insertion during IME composition (#45510).
  • Icon: Making size prop work for icon components using dash icon strings (#45593)
  • ToolsPanelItem: Prevent unintended calls to onDeselect when parent panel is remounted and item is rendered via SlotFill (#45673)
  • ColorPicker: Prevent all number fields from becoming "0" when one of them is an empty string (#45649).
  • ToggleControl: Fix toggle control label text overflow (#45962).

Internal

  • ToolsPanel: Update to fix exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45715).
  • PaletteEditListView: Update to ignore exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45467).
  • Popover: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45656).
  • Flex: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45528).
  • withNotices: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45530).
  • ItemGroup: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45531).
  • TabPanel: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45660).
  • NavigatorScreen: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45648).
  • Draggable: Convert to TypeScript (#45471).
  • MenuGroup: Convert to TypeScript (#45617).
  • useCx: fix story to satisfy the react-hooks/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45614)
  • Activate the react-hooks/exhuastive-deps eslint rule for the Components package (#41166)
  • Snackbar: Convert to TypeScript (#45472).

Experimental

  • ToggleGroupControl: Only show enclosing border when isBlock and not isDeselectable (#45492).
  • Theme: Add support for custom background color (#45466).

22.0.0 (2022-11-02)

Breaking Changes

  • Popover: The deprecated range and __unstableShift props have been removed (#45195).

Deprecations

  • Popover: the deprecation messages for anchor-related props (anchorRef, anchorRect, getAnchorRect) have been updated (#45195).

issue.title: chore(deps-dev): bump @wordpress/components from 21.3.0 to 22.1.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 21.3.0 to 22.1.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

22.1.0 (2022-11-16)

Enhancements

  • ColorPalette, BorderBox, BorderBoxControl: polish and DRY prop types, add default values (#45463).
  • TabPanel: Add ability to set icon only tab buttons (#45005).

Internal

  • AnglePickerControl: remove :focus-visible' outline on CircleOutlineWrapper` (#45758)

Bug Fix

  • FormTokenField: Fix duplicate input in IME composition (#45607).
  • Autocomplete: Check key events more strictly in IME composition (#45626).
  • Autocomplete: Fix unexpected block insertion during IME composition (#45510).
  • Icon: Making size prop work for icon components using dash icon strings (#45593)
  • ToolsPanelItem: Prevent unintended calls to onDeselect when parent panel is remounted and item is rendered via SlotFill (#45673)
  • ColorPicker: Prevent all number fields from becoming "0" when one of them is an empty string (#45649).
  • ToggleControl: Fix toggle control label text overflow (#45962).

Internal

  • ToolsPanel: Update to fix exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45715).
  • PaletteEditListView: Update to ignore exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45467).
  • Popover: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45656).
  • Flex: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45528).
  • withNotices: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45530).
  • ItemGroup: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45531).
  • TabPanel: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45660).
  • NavigatorScreen: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45648).
  • Draggable: Convert to TypeScript (#45471).
  • MenuGroup: Convert to TypeScript (#45617).
  • useCx: fix story to satisfy the react-hooks/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45614)
  • Activate the react-hooks/exhuastive-deps eslint rule for the Components package (#41166)
  • Snackbar: Convert to TypeScript (#45472).

Experimental

  • ToggleGroupControl: Only show enclosing border when isBlock and not isDeselectable (#45492).
  • Theme: Add support for custom background color (#45466).

22.0.0 (2022-11-02)

Breaking Changes

  • Popover: The deprecated range and __unstableShift props have been removed (#45195).

Deprecations

  • Popover: the deprecation messages for anchor-related props (anchorRef, anchorRect, getAnchorRect) have been updated (#45195).

... (truncated)

chore(release): 3.4.7

##### [Version 3.4.7](https://github.com/Codeinwp/neve/compare/v3.4.6...v3.4.7) (2022-12-01)

- [Fix] Customizer not working in some specific cases.
- [Feat] Add toggle to enable local hosting for Google fonts
- [Fix] PHP Warnings related to HFG Row BG on Legacy Skin
- [Fix] Text color not configurable with menu skin mode 2
- [Fix] Missing space on the Neve menu HTML
- [Fix] Full Canvas Mobile Menu Overlaps Some HTML Content
- Autoactivate TPC from the welcome notice
- Change the dashboard link from Nolt to GitHub discussion

issue.title: customizer is not loading if Neve v3.4.6 is used with PHP v8.0.x

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the bug in a clear and concise way. -->
The theme customizer is not loading if Neve v3.4.6 is used with PHP v8.0.x. I have checked with 8.0.11, 8.0.25, and 8.0.26. If we rollback the theme to its previous version, it works fine with all PHP versions. 

The same issue occurs if we use the latest version of OrbitFox. If a site has Neve and Orbit Fox, then we need to roll back both of them to get the customizer work again. 

### How to reproduce:
<!-- Describe the steps needed to reproduce this. -->
1. Create an instance with PHP v8.0.11, 8.0.25, or 8.0.26.
2. Install Neve
3. Access customizer

issue.title: [wip] Dynamic Value Additions
issue.body:
<!-- Issues that this pull request closes. -->
Closes #1218.
<!-- Should look like this: `Closes #1, #2, #3.` . -->

### Summary
<!-- Please describe the changes you made. -->
- Added Parameter based Dynamic Value
- Added a country location for Dynamic Value & Conditions using https://www.geoplugin.com
- Add Cookie based Block Conditions

### Screenshots <!-- if applicable -->

----

### Test instructions
<!-- Describe how this pull request can be tested. -->

1. A parameter-based dynamic value, so you can show a value, let's say brand, based on if the user has that keyword as a parameter in their URL, like example.com?brand=puma, then it will display Puma.

2. A location-based Dynamic Condition to show your country and Block conditions. It's based on your IP so might not be correct 100% of the times, maybe test with VPN too to see.

3. It's similar to how Meta works but just with PHP cookies. You can see how you can add cookie to your website, you can use the otter-blocks.php file to add the code and view the website in the frontend: https://www.w3schools.com/php/php_cookies.asp

---- 

### Checklist before the final review

- [x] Visual elements are not affected by independent changes.
- [x] It is at least compatible with the [minimum WordPress version](https://wordpress.org/plugins/otter-blocks/).
- [x] It loads additional script in frontend only if it is required.
- [x] Does not impact the [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/vitals/).
- [x] In case of deprecation, old blocks are safely migrated.

issue.title: Remove the visibility conditions upsell
issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the requested feature in a clear and concise way. -->

The general idea is that the PRO upsells should not confuse users and don't let them experience the feature properly. In this case the button is too obvious, more obvious than Add a rule setting: https://vertis.d.pr/i/F6fl2m. For a first time user of the feature, our priority is that they try the feature & only after we ask for an upgrade.

Possible solutions: 

1. Simple one, remove that button: https://vertis.d.pr/i/F6fl2m. The user would open the dropdown and they would see that there are more options and which one as well, there is no better upsell than this.2. 

2. More complicated. Show a cleaner upgrade button, but only after the user added at least a rule on their site.

### Alternatives:
<!-- If we don't implement this feature, what would be the best alternatives to achieve the same functionality? -->

cc @HardeepAsrani @mghenciu

issue.title: Posts block doesn't show the Sticky post as a featured post.
issue.body:
### Description:
A user has asked about this on the wp.org forum that if he can use the sticky post as a featured post in Otter's posts block.

When you use the Posts block and turn on the featured post option, then the sticky post doesn't appear as a featured post. The sticky post appears at the top of the Blog/Archive page so his query is if it can be also used here and if it could appear as a featured post.

P.s  - I am not sure If I should add an enhancement tag or the bug tag.😅

### How to reproduce:

1. Create some demo posts.
2. Go to any random post and make it a sticky post by going to post settings [See attached screenshot in reference].
3. Install Otter and Create a new page.
4. Use Otter's **Posts Block** and turn on the featured post option. 
5. Go to the page and observe that the post which is featured on top is the latest post that was created by you. If you will create a new post then the new post will appear as a Featured post.
6. Now go to the Blog/Archive page and see that the sticky post appears at the top instead of the latest post.


### Expected behavior:
The posts block should show the Sticky post as a featured post. 

### Current behavior:
The posts block doesn't show the Sticky post as a featured post. 

### Reference:
<!-- Screenshots and links that show the bug -->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110405452/201397469-6dfecb4c-d578-43a5-9254-8c90911dec9e.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110405452/201399366-11be7018-7aa7-4586-9a2f-fcc4fae2f1d9.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110405452/201398979-f066c956-3473-4fe9-8daf-f456668e390d.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/110405452/201399183-31b22879-b5df-4372-abee-df3987ecf789.png)

The user asked here : https://wordpress.org/support/topic/can-i-keep-the-sticky-post-as-the-featured-post-in-the-posts-block/
### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1
* Plugin version: 2.1.3

issue.title: Query loops with Otter Dynamic Values and Links

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

labels.name: Custom layouts
labels.description: Issues related to the compatibility between Otter and Neve custom layouts

issue.body:
We will need to discuss and see how we will manage the **Custom Layout Archive templates** using Otter. Currently I have attempted to use Otter Dynamic values and links inside the Core query loops.

An example can be found in this page: https://demosites.io/otter/category/technology/

As you see, in the context of query loop the Dynamic (featured) image and the Post excerpt do not appear to work. This will be important in the context of the hybrid approach we will attempt for Neve as well.

![Screenshot 2022-10-17 at 19 47 11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4193672/196236194-8403ffb0-7453-442a-87ab-4919dde28f31.png)

Is it possible to make our Otter dynamic elements work well in the Core's query loop? Or it is worth looking into how we can develop our custom Query loop solution?

issue.title: Product Review Block Structured Data Issue with 1-5 Rating Scale

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
When using the 1-5 rating scale, there are some cases that generate structured data to be invalid.
When you enable a 1-5 rating scale in Otter options the scale in the editor still shows a 1-10 scale. Depending on the ratings you input this can lead to invalid structured data.

### How to reproduce:
1. Enable the 1-5 rating scale in Otter options
2. Add a review block with 4 product features 
3. Give each feature a rating of 1 star.

### Expected behaviour:
The final rating for this product should be 1 start.

### Current behaviour:
The final rating for this product is 0.5 stars.
Even though the schema is valid when I run it through the [validator](https://validator.schema.org/), this still throws and error in [Rich Results Test](https://search.google.com/test/rich-results) and shows up in GSC. The error in question is: 'Rating is outside the specified or default range.'

### Reference:
[Example](https://finmasters.com/restoration-hardware-credit-card-review/)

### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1.1
* Plugin version: 2.1.4

issue.title: Sticky Banner Mode
issue.body:
<!-- Issues that this pull request closes. -->
Closes #.
<!-- Should look like this: `Closes #1, #2, #3.` . -->

### Summary
<!-- Please describe the changes you made. -->

Make the sticky block act like a banner by adding extra space at the top of the page.

New options:

- `o-sticky-header-space`: activate the header space
- `o-sticky-header-gap-{value}`: set gap space. By default, it uses the block `height`, but is not always reliable. Use this to make adjustments. Example: `o-sticky-banner-gap-50px`, adds a margin of 50px to the body.


### Screenshots <!-- if applicable -->

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/17597852/203324840-075e700a-922b-416d-a084-000e0f599636.png)

issue.body:
<!-- Issues that this pull request closes. -->
Closes #1377 .
<!-- Should look like this: `Closes #1, #2, #3.` . -->

### Summary
<!-- Please describe the changes you made. -->

Add a fix for Evergreen reset and docs.

### Screenshots <!-- if applicable -->

----

### Test instructions
<!-- Describe how this pull request can be tested. -->

1. Add a Countdown with the mode Evergreen
2. Set the time, then preview.
3. Test time reset on __refresh__, which has the conditions:
    1. Time is over.
    2. Timezone has changed 
    3. Deadline has changed.

If you think the time should have reset in a situation that is not mentioned, please post the scenario 🙏 .

For Timezone, you can use the Sensor tab from the browser Dev Tools (Chrome)

Install a fresh Feedzy instance with the default Core theme - Twenty Twenty-Three 2. Go to the Import Posts page, and start an import 3. issue.title: Unable to add all the Magic tags in one flow.
issue.body:
### Description:
Hey there, I noticed this minor bug in the import job process of the feedzy. When you will create an import job and try to add the magic tags to the **Content field**, then you will notice that you are not able to add all the tags in one flow from the dropdown.

In order to add another tag you will have to click out somewhere on the screen, and only then you will be able to add other tags.

I tried to do the same thing with the **Title field** and it is working fine, we can add multiple tags in one flow.

Thank you.

### How to reproduce:

1. Create an Import job.
2. See the screencast video replicating this issue.


### Reference:
See this screencast: https://vertis.d.pr/v/FcpMdH

### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1
* Plugin version: 4.0.5

issue.title: chore(deps-dev): bump @wordpress/components from 21.3.0 to 22.1.0

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: javascript
labels.description: Pull requests that update Javascript code

issue.body:
Bumps [@wordpress/components](https://github.com/WordPress/gutenberg/tree/HEAD/packages/components) from 21.3.0 to 22.1.0.
Changelog

Sourced from @​wordpress/components's changelog.

22.1.0 (2022-11-16)

Enhancements

  • ColorPalette, BorderBox, BorderBoxControl: polish and DRY prop types, add default values (#45463).
  • TabPanel: Add ability to set icon only tab buttons (#45005).

Internal

  • AnglePickerControl: remove :focus-visible' outline on CircleOutlineWrapper` (#45758)

Bug Fix

  • FormTokenField: Fix duplicate input in IME composition (#45607).
  • Autocomplete: Check key events more strictly in IME composition (#45626).
  • Autocomplete: Fix unexpected block insertion during IME composition (#45510).
  • Icon: Making size prop work for icon components using dash icon strings (#45593)
  • ToolsPanelItem: Prevent unintended calls to onDeselect when parent panel is remounted and item is rendered via SlotFill (#45673)
  • ColorPicker: Prevent all number fields from becoming "0" when one of them is an empty string (#45649).
  • ToggleControl: Fix toggle control label text overflow (#45962).

Internal

  • ToolsPanel: Update to fix exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45715).
  • PaletteEditListView: Update to ignore exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45467).
  • Popover: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45656).
  • Flex: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45528).
  • withNotices: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45530).
  • ItemGroup: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45531).
  • TabPanel: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45660).
  • NavigatorScreen: Update to pass exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45648).
  • Draggable: Convert to TypeScript (#45471).
  • MenuGroup: Convert to TypeScript (#45617).
  • useCx: fix story to satisfy the react-hooks/exhaustive-deps eslint rule (#45614)
  • Activate the react-hooks/exhuastive-deps eslint rule for the Components package (#41166)
  • Snackbar: Convert to TypeScript (#45472).

Experimental

  • ToggleGroupControl: Only show enclosing border when isBlock and not isDeselectable (#45492).
  • Theme: Add support for custom background color (#45466).

22.0.0 (2022-11-02)

Breaking Changes

  • Popover: The deprecated range and __unstableShift props have been removed (#45195).

Deprecations

  • Popover: the deprecation messages for anchor-related props (anchorRef, anchorRect, getAnchorRect) have been updated (#45195).

... (truncated)

issue.title: customizer is not loading if Neve v3.4.6 is used with PHP v8.0.x

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
<!-- Describe the bug in a clear and concise way. -->
The theme customizer is not loading if Neve v3.4.6 is used with PHP v8.0.x. I have checked with 8.0.11, 8.0.25, and 8.0.26. If we rollback the theme to its previous version, it works fine with all PHP versions. 

The same issue occurs if we use the latest version of OrbitFox. If a site has Neve and Orbit Fox, then we need to roll back both of them to get the customizer work again. 

### How to reproduce:
<!-- Describe the steps needed to reproduce this. -->
1. Create an instance with PHP v8.0.11, 8.0.25, or 8.0.26.
2. Install Neve
3. Access customizer

### Expected behaviour:
customizer should load properly.

### Current behaviour:
customizer is not loading, 

### Reference:
<!-- Screenshots and links that show the bug -->
Screenshot >>https://vertis.d.pr/i/b1fDRt
### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1.1
* Theme version: 3.4.6
* HS Tickets: https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/2078727475/346297?folderId=212390
* https://secure.helpscout.net/conversation/2080399962/346513?folderId=212390

issue.title: [wip] Dynamic Value Additions
issue.body:
<!-- Issues that this pull request closes. -->
Closes #1218.
<!-- Should look like this: `Closes #1, #2, #3.` . -->

### Summary
<!-- Please describe the changes you made. -->
- Added Parameter based Dynamic Value
- Added a country location for Dynamic Value & Conditions using https://www.geoplugin.com
- Add Cookie based Block Conditions

### Screenshots <!-- if applicable -->

----

### Test instructions
<!-- Describe how this pull request can be tested. -->

1. A parameter-based dynamic value, so you can show a value, let's say brand, based on if the user has that keyword as a parameter in their URL, like example.com?brand=puma, then it will display Puma.

2. A location-based Dynamic Condition to show your country and Block conditions. It's based on your IP so might not be correct 100% of the times, maybe test with VPN too to see.

3. It's similar to how Meta works but just with PHP cookies. You can see how you can add cookie to your website, you can use the otter-blocks.php file to add the code and view the website in the frontend: https://www.w3schools.com/php/php_cookies.asp

---- 

### Checklist before the final review

- [x] Visual elements are not affected by independent changes.
- [x] It is at least compatible with the [minimum WordPress version](https://wordpress.org/plugins/otter-blocks/).
- [x] It loads additional script in frontend only if it is required.
- [x] Does not impact the [Core Web Vitals](https://web.dev/vitals/).
- [x] In case of deprecation, old blocks are safely migrated.
- [x] It is usable in Widgets and FSE.
- [x] Copy/Paste is working if the attributes are modified.

issue.title: Accessibility error : missing space on the Neve menu HTML

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body:
### Description:
A user on wp.org told that he is getting an Accessibility issue with the Neve Menu navigation on accessibility/section 508 scanners. The lack of space generates the following accessibility error. The error Says - `“No space between attributes.”` 

We need to update the inc/views/nav_walker.php file (line 136) and insert a space after the role=”none” parameter.

Thanks

### Expected behaviour:
https://vertis.d.pr/i/Y3EIMp

### Current behaviour:
https://vertis.d.pr/i/9CKbFL
### Reference:
https://wordpress.org/support/topic/accessibility-missing-space-on-menu-html/

### Technical info
* WordPress version: 6.1
* Theme version: 3.4.3
